description: A bullish continuation pattern resembling a teacup with a handle. The 'cup' is a rounded bottom showing gradual accumulation, followed by a small downward drift (the 'handle') before breakout to new highs.

structure: Cup should be U-shaped with rounded bottom (not V-shaped)
Cup depth: ideally 12-33% retracement from prior high
Cup duration: typically 1-6 months on daily charts, several weeks on weekly
Handle forms in upper third of cup after price recovers to near prior highs
Handle should drift down or sideways 10-15% from cup high
Handle duration: 1-4 weeks, significantly shorter than cup
Breakout occurs above handle resistance and cup rim
volume: Volume high on left side of cup (selling climax)
Volume decreases significantly at cup bottom (selling exhaustion)
Volume increases as price rises on right side of cup (accumulation)
Volume decreases during handle formation (pullback on light volume = bullish)
Strong volume spike on breakout above handle confirms pattern
indicators: RSI should drop to 30-40 at cup bottom then recover to 50-60 range
No bearish divergence on handle - RSI should stay above 40
MACD crosses bullish during right side of cup formation
Price should stay above 50-day or 200-day MA during handle (depends on cup depth)
timeframe: Classic pattern on daily and weekly charts
Can work on 4H for shorter-term setups
Requires patience - takes months to fully develop

invalidation_signals: Cup has V-shaped bottom instead of rounded (different pattern - not cup and handle)
Handle drifts down more than 50% of cup depth (too deep = weakness)
Handle lasts longer than half the cup duration (losing validity)
Volume increasing during handle formation (distribution, not healthy pullback)
Price breaks below handle low before breakout (invalidates pattern)
No clear prior uptrend before cup formation
Cup depth too shallow (<10%) or too deep (>50%) - outside typical range
common_mistakes: Accepting V-shaped bottoms - cup must be rounded showing gradual accumulation
Ignoring handle depth - handles that retrace >33% often fail
Not waiting for volume confirmation on breakout
Confusing with rounding bottom (which has no handle)
Missing the volume pattern - declining volume at bottom and during handle is critical
Entering during handle formation before breakout (premature entry)

trade_setup.entry: Enter on breakout above handle resistance with strong volume
trade_setup.stop_loss: Place below handle low or below cup bottom for wider stop
trade_setup.target: Measure cup depth, add to breakout point for minimum target (often exceeds this)
